00048 /* Math stuff for ray casting on mesh faces and for nearest surface */
00049 
00050 float bvhtree_ray_tri_intersection(const BVHTreeRay *ray, const float UNUSED(m_dist), const float v0[3], const float v1[3], const float v2[3])
00051 {
00052     float dist;
00053 
00054     if (isect_ray_tri_epsilon_v3(ray->origin, ray->direction, v0, v1, v2, &dist, NULL, FLT_EPSILON))
00055         return dist;
00056 
00057     return FLT_MAX;
00058 }
00059 
00060 static float sphereray_tri_intersection(const BVHTreeRay *ray, float radius, const float m_dist, const float v0[3], const float v1[3], const float v2[3])
00061 {
00062     
00063     float idist;
00064     float p1[3];
00065     float plane_normal[3], hit_point[3];
00066 
00067     normal_tri_v3(plane_normal, v0, v1, v2);
00068 
00069     madd_v3_v3v3fl(p1, ray->origin, ray->direction, m_dist);
00070     if (isect_sweeping_sphere_tri_v3(ray->origin, p1, radius, v0, v1, v2, &idist, hit_point)) {
00071         return idist * m_dist;
00072     }
00073 
00074     return FLT_MAX;
00075 }

00077 
00078 /*
00079  * Function adapted from David Eberly's distance tools (LGPL)
00080  * http://www.geometrictools.com/LibFoundation/Distance/Distance.html
00081  */
00082 float nearest_point_in_tri_surface(const float v0[3], const float v1[3], const float v2[3], const float p[3], int *v, int *e, float nearest[3])
00083 {
00084     float diff[3];
00085     float e0[3];
00086     float e1[3];
00087     float A00;
00088     float A01;
00089     float A11;
00090     float B0;
00091     float B1;
00092     float C;
00093     float Det;
00094     float S;
00095     float T;
00096     float sqrDist;
00097     int lv = -1, le = -1;
00098     
00099     sub_v3_v3v3(diff, v0, p);
00100     sub_v3_v3v3(e0, v1, v0);
00101     sub_v3_v3v3(e1, v2, v0);
00102     
00103     A00 = dot_v3v3(e0, e0);
00104     A01 = dot_v3v3(e0, e1 );
00105     A11 = dot_v3v3(e1, e1 );
00106     B0 = dot_v3v3(diff, e0 );
00107     B1 = dot_v3v3(diff, e1 );
00108     C = dot_v3v3(diff, diff );
00109     Det = fabs( A00 * A11 - A01 * A01 );
00110     S = A01 * B1 - A11 * B0;
00111     T = A01 * B0 - A00 * B1;
00112 
00113     if (S + T <= Det) {
00114         if (S < 0.0f) {
00115             if (T < 0.0f) { /* Region 4 */
00116                 if (B0 < 0.0f) {
00117                     T = 0.0f;
00118                     if (-B0 >= A00) {
00119                         S = 1.0f;
00120                         sqrDist = A00 + 2.0f * B0 + C;
00121                         lv = 1;
00122                     }
00123                     else {
00124                         if (fabsf(A00) > FLT_EPSILON)
00125                             S = -B0/A00;
00126                         else
00127                             S = 0.0f;
00128                         sqrDist = B0 * S + C;
00129                         le = 0;
00130                     }
00131                 }
00132                 else {
00133                     S = 0.0f;
00134                     if (B1 >= 0.0f) {
00135                         T = 0.0f;
00136                         sqrDist = C;
00137                         lv = 0;
00138                     }
00139                     else if (-B1 >= A11) {
00140                         T = 1.0f;
00141                         sqrDist = A11 + 2.0f * B1 + C;
00142                         lv = 2;
00143                     }
00144                     else {
00145                         if (fabsf(A11) > FLT_EPSILON)
00146                             T = -B1 / A11;
00147                         else
00148                             T = 0.0f;
00149                         sqrDist = B1 * T + C;
00150                         le = 1;
00151                     }
00152                 }
00153             }
00154             else { /* Region 3 */
00155                 S = 0.0f;
00156                 if (B1 >= 0.0f) {
00157                     T = 0.0f;
00158                     sqrDist = C;
00159                     lv = 0;
00160                 }
00161                 else if (-B1 >= A11) {
00162                     T = 1.0f;
00163                     sqrDist = A11 + 2.0f * B1 + C;
00164                     lv = 2;
00165                 }
00166                 else {
00167                     if (fabsf(A11) > FLT_EPSILON)
00168                         T = -B1 / A11;
00169                     else
00170                         T = 0.0;
00171                     sqrDist = B1 * T + C;
00172                     le = 1;
00173                 }
00174             }
00175         }
00176         else if (T < 0.0f) { /* Region 5 */
00177             T = 0.0f;
00178             if (B0 >= 0.0f) {
00179                 S = 0.0f;
00180                 sqrDist = C;
00181                 lv = 0;
00182             }
00183             else if (-B0 >= A00) {
00184                 S = 1.0f;
00185                 sqrDist = A00 + 2.0f * B0 + C;
00186                 lv = 1;
00187             }
00188             else {
00189                 if (fabsf(A00) > FLT_EPSILON)
00190                     S = -B0 / A00;
00191                 else
00192                     S = 0.0f;
00193                 sqrDist = B0 * S + C;
00194                 le = 0;
00195             }
00196         }
00197         else { /* Region 0 */
00198             // Minimum at interior lv
00199             float invDet;
00200             if (fabsf(Det) > FLT_EPSILON)
00201                 invDet = 1.0f / Det;
00202             else
00203                 invDet = 0.0f;
00204             S *= invDet;
00205             T *= invDet;
00206             sqrDist = S * ( A00 * S + A01 * T + 2.0f * B0) +
00207                       T * ( A01 * S + A11 * T + 2.0f * B1 ) + C;
00208         }
00209     }
00210     else {
00211         float tmp0, tmp1, numer, denom;
00212 
00213         if (S < 0.0f) { /* Region 2 */
00214             tmp0 = A01 + B0;
00215             tmp1 = A11 + B1;
00216             if ( tmp1 > tmp0 ) {
00217                 numer = tmp1 - tmp0;
00218                 denom = A00 - 2.0f * A01 + A11;
00219                 if ( numer >= denom ) {
00220                     S = 1.0f;
00221                     T = 0.0f;
00222                     sqrDist = A00 + 2.0f * B0 + C;
00223                     lv = 1;
00224                 }
00225                 else {
00226                     if (fabsf(denom) > FLT_EPSILON)
00227                         S = numer / denom;
00228                     else
00229                         S = 0.0f;
00230                     T = 1.0f - S;
00231                     sqrDist = S * ( A00 * S + A01 * T + 2.0f * B0 ) +
00232                               T * ( A01 * S + A11 * T + 2.0f * B1 ) + C;
00233                     le = 2;
00234                 }
00235             }
00236             else {
00237                 S = 0.0f;
00238                 if ( tmp1 <= 0.0f ) {
00239                     T = 1.0f;
00240                     sqrDist = A11 + 2.0f * B1 + C;
00241                     lv = 2;
00242                 }
00243                 else if (B1 >= 0.0f) {
00244                     T = 0.0f;
00245                     sqrDist = C;
00246                     lv = 0;
00247                 }
00248                 else {
00249                     if (fabsf(A11) > FLT_EPSILON)
00250                         T = -B1 / A11;
00251                     else
00252                         T = 0.0f;
00253                     sqrDist = B1 * T + C;
00254                     le = 1;
00255                 }
00256             }
00257         }
00258         else if (T < 0.0f) { /* Region 6 */
00259             tmp0 = A01 + B1;
00260             tmp1 = A00 + B0;
00261             if ( tmp1 > tmp0 ) {
00262                 numer = tmp1 - tmp0;
00263                 denom = A00 - 2.0f * A01 + A11;
00264                 if ( numer >= denom ) {
00265                     T = 1.0f;
00266                     S = 0.0f;
00267                     sqrDist = A11 + 2.0f * B1 + C;
00268                     lv = 2;
00269                 }
00270                 else {
00271                     if (fabsf(denom) > FLT_EPSILON)
00272                         T = numer / denom;
00273                     else
00274                         T = 0.0f;
00275                     S = 1.0f - T;
00276                     sqrDist = S * ( A00 * S + A01 * T + 2.0f * B0 ) +
00277                               T * ( A01 * S + A11 * T + 2.0f * B1 ) + C;
00278                     le = 2;
00279                 }
00280             }
00281             else {
00282                 T = 0.0f;
00283                 if (tmp1 <= 0.0f) {
00284                     S = 1.0f;
00285                     sqrDist = A00 + 2.0f * B0 + C;
00286                     lv = 1;
00287                 }
00288                 else if (B0 >= 0.0f) {
00289                     S = 0.0f;
00290                     sqrDist = C;
00291                     lv = 0;
00292                 }
00293                 else {
00294                     if (fabsf(A00) > FLT_EPSILON)
00295                         S = -B0 / A00;
00296                     else
00297                         S = 0.0f;
00298                     sqrDist = B0 * S + C;
00299                     le = 0;
00300                 }
00301             }
00302         }
00303         else { /* Region 1 */
00304             numer = A11 + B1 - A01 - B0;
00305             if ( numer <= 0.0f ) {
00306                 S = 0.0f;
00307                 T = 1.0f;
00308                 sqrDist = A11 + 2.0f * B1 + C;
00309                 lv = 2;
00310             }
00311             else {
00312                 denom = A00 - 2.0f * A01 + A11;
00313                 if ( numer >= denom ) {
00314                     S = 1.0f;
00315                     T = 0.0f;
00316                     sqrDist = A00 + 2.0f * B0 + C;
00317                     lv = 1;
00318                 }
00319                 else {
00320                     if (fabsf(denom) > FLT_EPSILON)
00321                         S = numer / denom;
00322                     else
00323                         S = 0.0f;
00324                     T = 1.0f - S;
00325                     sqrDist = S * ( A00 * S + A01 * T + 2.0f * B0 ) +
00326                               T * ( A01 * S + A11 * T + 2.0f * B1 ) + C;
00327                     le = 2;
00328                 }
00329             }
00330         }
00331     }
00332 
00333     // Account for numerical round-off error
00334     if ( sqrDist < FLT_EPSILON )
00335         sqrDist = 0.0f;
00336     
00337     {
00338         float w[3], x[3], y[3], z[3];
00339         copy_v3_v3(w, v0);
00340         copy_v3_v3(x, e0);
00341         mul_v3_fl(x, S);
00342         copy_v3_v3(y, e1);
00343         mul_v3_fl(y, T);
00344         add_v3_v3v3(z, w, x);
00345         add_v3_v3v3(z, z, y);
00346         //sub_v3_v3v3(d, p, z);
00347         copy_v3_v3(nearest, z);
00348         // d = p - ( v0 + S * e0 + T * e1 );
00349     }
00350     *v = lv;
00351     *e = le;
00352 
00353     return sqrDist;
00354 }

00361 // Callback to bvh tree nearest point. The tree must bust have been built using bvhtree_from_mesh_faces.
00362 // userdata must be a BVHMeshCallbackUserdata built from the same mesh as the tree.
00363 static void mesh_faces_nearest_point(void *userdata, int index, const float co[3], BVHTreeNearest *nearest)
00364 {
00365     const BVHTreeFromMesh *data = (BVHTreeFromMesh*) userdata;
00366     MVert *vert = data->vert;
00367     MFace *face = data->face + index;
00368 
00369     float *t0, *t1, *t2, *t3;
00370     t0 = vert[ face->v1 ].co;
00371     t1 = vert[ face->v2 ].co;
00372     t2 = vert[ face->v3 ].co;
00373     t3 = face->v4 ? vert[ face->v4].co : NULL;
00374 
00375     
00376     do
00377     {   
00378         float nearest_tmp[3], dist;
00379         int vertex, edge;
00380         
00381         dist = nearest_point_in_tri_surface(t0, t1, t2, co, &vertex, &edge, nearest_tmp);
00382         if (dist < nearest->dist) {
00383             nearest->index = index;
00384             nearest->dist = dist;
00385             copy_v3_v3(nearest->co, nearest_tmp);
00386             normal_tri_v3( nearest->no,t0, t1, t2);
00387         }
00388 
00389         t1 = t2;
00390         t2 = t3;
00391         t3 = NULL;
00392 
00393     } while (t2);
00394 }
00395 
00396 // Callback to bvh tree raycast. The tree must bust have been built using bvhtree_from_mesh_faces.
00397 // userdata must be a BVHMeshCallbackUserdata built from the same mesh as the tree.
00398 static void mesh_faces_spherecast(void *userdata, int index, const BVHTreeRay *ray, BVHTreeRayHit *hit)
00399 {
00400     const BVHTreeFromMesh *data = (BVHTreeFromMesh*) userdata;
00401     MVert *vert = data->vert;
00402     MFace *face = data->face + index;
00403 
00404     float *t0, *t1, *t2, *t3;
00405     t0 = vert[ face->v1 ].co;
00406     t1 = vert[ face->v2 ].co;
00407     t2 = vert[ face->v3 ].co;
00408     t3 = face->v4 ? vert[ face->v4].co : NULL;
00409 
00410     
00411     do
00412     {   
00413         float dist;
00414         if (data->sphere_radius == 0.0f)
00415             dist = bvhtree_ray_tri_intersection(ray, hit->dist, t0, t1, t2);
00416         else
00417             dist = sphereray_tri_intersection(ray, data->sphere_radius, hit->dist, t0, t1, t2);
00418 
00419         if (dist >= 0 && dist < hit->dist) {
00420             hit->index = index;
00421             hit->dist = dist;
00422             madd_v3_v3v3fl(hit->co, ray->origin, ray->direction, dist);
00423 
00424             normal_tri_v3( hit->no,t0, t1, t2);
00425         }
00426 
00427         t1 = t2;
00428         t2 = t3;
00429         t3 = NULL;
00430 
00431     } while (t2);
00432 }
00433 
00434 // Callback to bvh tree nearest point. The tree must bust have been built using bvhtree_from_mesh_edges.
00435 // userdata must be a BVHMeshCallbackUserdata built from the same mesh as the tree.
00436 static void mesh_edges_nearest_point(void *userdata, int index, const float co[3], BVHTreeNearest *nearest)
00437 {
00438     const BVHTreeFromMesh *data = (BVHTreeFromMesh*) userdata;
00439     MVert *vert = data->vert;
00440     MEdge *edge = data->edge + index;
00441     float nearest_tmp[3], dist;
00442 
00443     float *t0, *t1;
00444     t0 = vert[ edge->v1 ].co;
00445     t1 = vert[ edge->v2 ].co;
00446 
00447     closest_to_line_segment_v3(nearest_tmp, co, t0, t1);
00448     dist = len_squared_v3v3(nearest_tmp, co);
00449     
00450     if (dist < nearest->dist) {
00451         nearest->index = index;
00452         nearest->dist = dist;
00453         copy_v3_v3(nearest->co, nearest_tmp);
00454         sub_v3_v3v3(nearest->no, t0, t1);
00455         normalize_v3(nearest->no);
00456     }
00457 }

00459 /*
00460  * BVH builders
00461  */
00462 // Builds a bvh tree.. where nodes are the vertexs of the given mesh
00463 BVHTree* bvhtree_from_mesh_verts(BVHTreeFromMesh *data, DerivedMesh *mesh, float epsilon, int tree_type, int axis)
00464 {
00465     BVHTree *tree = bvhcache_find(&mesh->bvhCache, BVHTREE_FROM_VERTICES);
00466 
00467     //Not in cache
00468     if (tree == NULL) {
00469         int i;
00470         int numVerts= mesh->getNumVerts(mesh);
00471         MVert *vert = mesh->getVertDataArray(mesh, CD_MVERT);
00472 
00473         if (vert != NULL) {
00474             tree = BLI_bvhtree_new(numVerts, epsilon, tree_type, axis);
00475 
00476             if (tree != NULL) {
00477                 for (i = 0; i < numVerts; i++) {
00478                     BLI_bvhtree_insert(tree, i, vert[i].co, 1);
00479                 }
00480 
00481                 BLI_bvhtree_balance(tree);
00482 
00483                 //Save on cache for later use
00484 //              printf("BVHTree built and saved on cache\n");
00485                 bvhcache_insert(&mesh->bvhCache, tree, BVHTREE_FROM_VERTICES);
00486             }
00487         }
00488     }
00489     else {
00490 //      printf("BVHTree is already build, using cached tree\n");
00491     }
00492 
00493 
00494     //Setup BVHTreeFromMesh
00495     memset(data, 0, sizeof(*data));
00496     data->tree = tree;
00497 
00498     if (data->tree) {
00499         data->cached = TRUE;
00500 
00501         //a NULL nearest callback works fine
00502         //remeber the min distance to point is the same as the min distance to BV of point
00503         data->nearest_callback = NULL;
00504         data->raycast_callback = NULL;
00505 
00506         data->mesh = mesh;
00507         data->vert = mesh->getVertDataArray(mesh, CD_MVERT);
00508         data->face = mesh->getTessFaceDataArray(mesh, CD_MFACE);
00509 
00510         data->sphere_radius = epsilon;
00511     }
00512 
00513     return data->tree;
00514 }
00515 
00516 // Builds a bvh tree.. where nodes are the faces of the given mesh.
00517 BVHTree* bvhtree_from_mesh_faces(BVHTreeFromMesh *data, DerivedMesh *mesh, float epsilon, int tree_type, int axis)
00518 {
00519     BVHTree *tree = bvhcache_find(&mesh->bvhCache, BVHTREE_FROM_FACES);
00520 
00521     //Not in cache
00522     if (tree == NULL) {
00523         int i;
00524         int numFaces= mesh->getNumTessFaces(mesh);
00525 
00526         /* BMESH specific check that we have tessfaces,
00527          * we _could_ tessellate here but rather not - campbell
00528          *
00529          * this assert checks we have tessfaces,
00530          * if not caller should use DM_ensure_tessface() */
00531         BLI_assert(!(numFaces == 0 && mesh->getNumPolys(mesh) != 0));
00532 
00533         if (numFaces != 0) {
00534             /* Create a bvh-tree of the given target */
00535             tree = BLI_bvhtree_new(numFaces, epsilon, tree_type, axis);
00536             if (tree != NULL) {
00537                 BMEditMesh *em= data->em_evil;
00538                 if (em) {
00539                     /* data->em_evil is only set for snapping, and only for the mesh of the object
00540                      * which is currently open in edit mode. When set, the bvhtree should not contain
00541                      * faces that will interfere with snapping (e.g. faces that are hidden/selected
00542                      * or faces that have selected verts).*/
00543 
00544                     /* XXX, for snap only, em & dm are assumed to be aligned, since dm is the em's cage */
00545 
00546                     /* Insert BMesh-tessellation triangles into the bvh tree, unless they are hidden
00547                      * and/or selected. Even if the faces themselves are not selected for the snapped
00548                      * transform, having a vertex selected means the face (and thus it's tessellated
00549                      * triangles) will be moving and will not be a good snap targets.*/
00550                     for (i = 0; i < em->tottri; i++) {
00551                         BMLoop **tri = em->looptris[i];
00552                         BMFace *f;
00553                         BMVert *v;
00554                         BMIter iter;
00555                         int insert;
00556 
00557                         /* Each loop of the triangle points back to the BMFace it was tessellated from.
00558                          * All three should point to the same face, so just use the face from the first
00559                          * loop.*/
00560                         f = tri[0]->f;
00561 
00562                         /* If the looptris is ordered such that all triangles tessellated from a single
00563                          * faces are consecutive elements in the array, then we could speed up the tests
00564                          * below by using the insert value from the previous iteration.*/
00565 
00566                         /*Start with the assumption the triangle should be included for snapping.*/
00567                         insert = 1;
00568 
00569                         if (BM_elem_flag_test(f, BM_ELEM_SELECT) || BM_elem_flag_test(f, BM_ELEM_HIDDEN)) {
00570                             /* Don't insert triangles tessellated from faces that are hidden
00571                              * or selected*/
00572                             insert = 0;
00573                         }
00574                         else {
00575                             BM_ITER_ELEM (v, &iter, f, BM_VERTS_OF_FACE) {
00576                                 if (BM_elem_flag_test(v, BM_ELEM_SELECT)) {
00577                                     /* Don't insert triangles tessellated from faces that have
00578                                      * any selected verts.*/
00579                                     insert = 0;
00580                                 }
00581                             }
00582                         }
00583 
00584                         if (insert) {
00585                             /* No reason found to block hit-testing the triangle for snap,
00586                              * so insert it now.*/
00587                             float co[4][3];
00588                             copy_v3_v3(co[0], tri[0]->v->co);
00589                             copy_v3_v3(co[1], tri[1]->v->co);
00590                             copy_v3_v3(co[2], tri[2]->v->co);
00591                     
00592                             BLI_bvhtree_insert(tree, i, co[0], 3);
00593                         }
00594                     }
00595                 }
00596                 else {
00597                     MVert *vert = mesh->getVertDataArray(mesh, CD_MVERT);
00598                     MFace *face = mesh->getTessFaceDataArray(mesh, CD_MFACE);
00599 
00600                     if (vert != NULL && face != NULL) {
00601                         for (i = 0; i < numFaces; i++) {
00602                             float co[4][3];
00603                             copy_v3_v3(co[0], vert[ face[i].v1 ].co);
00604                             copy_v3_v3(co[1], vert[ face[i].v2 ].co);
00605                             copy_v3_v3(co[2], vert[ face[i].v3 ].co);
00606                             if (face[i].v4)
00607                                 copy_v3_v3(co[3], vert[ face[i].v4 ].co);
00608                     
00609                             BLI_bvhtree_insert(tree, i, co[0], face[i].v4 ? 4 : 3);
00610                         }
00611                     }
00612                 }
00613                 BLI_bvhtree_balance(tree);
00614 
00615                 //Save on cache for later use
00616 //              printf("BVHTree built and saved on cache\n");
00617                 bvhcache_insert(&mesh->bvhCache, tree, BVHTREE_FROM_FACES);
00618             }
00619         }
00620     }
00621     else {
00622 //      printf("BVHTree is already build, using cached tree\n");
00623     }
00624 
00625 
00626     //Setup BVHTreeFromMesh
00627     memset(data, 0, sizeof(*data));
00628     data->tree = tree;
00629 
00630     if (data->tree) {
00631         data->cached = TRUE;
00632 
00633         data->nearest_callback = mesh_faces_nearest_point;
00634         data->raycast_callback = mesh_faces_spherecast;
00635 
00636         data->mesh = mesh;
00637         data->vert = mesh->getVertDataArray(mesh, CD_MVERT);
00638         data->face = mesh->getTessFaceDataArray(mesh, CD_MFACE);
00639 
00640         data->sphere_radius = epsilon;
00641     }
00642     return data->tree;
00643 
00644 }
00645 
00646 // Builds a bvh tree.. where nodes are the faces of the given mesh.
00647 BVHTree* bvhtree_from_mesh_edges(BVHTreeFromMesh *data, DerivedMesh *mesh, float epsilon, int tree_type, int axis)
00648 {
00649     BVHTree *tree = bvhcache_find(&mesh->bvhCache, BVHTREE_FROM_EDGES);
00650 
00651     //Not in cache
00652     if (tree == NULL)
00653     {
00654         int i;
00655         int numEdges= mesh->getNumEdges(mesh);
00656         MVert *vert = mesh->getVertDataArray(mesh, CD_MVERT);
00657         MEdge *edge = mesh->getEdgeDataArray(mesh, CD_MEDGE);
00658 
00659         if (vert != NULL && edge != NULL) {
00660             /* Create a bvh-tree of the given target */
00661             tree = BLI_bvhtree_new(numEdges, epsilon, tree_type, axis);
00662             if (tree != NULL) {
00663                 for (i = 0; i < numEdges; i++) {
00664                     float co[4][3];
00665                     copy_v3_v3(co[0], vert[ edge[i].v1 ].co);
00666                     copy_v3_v3(co[1], vert[ edge[i].v2 ].co);
00667             
00668                     BLI_bvhtree_insert(tree, i, co[0], 2);
00669                 }
00670                 BLI_bvhtree_balance(tree);
00671 
00672                 //Save on cache for later use
00673 //              printf("BVHTree built and saved on cache\n");
00674                 bvhcache_insert(&mesh->bvhCache, tree, BVHTREE_FROM_EDGES);
00675             }
00676         }
00677     }
00678     else
00679     {
00680 //      printf("BVHTree is already build, using cached tree\n");
00681     }
00682 
00683 
00684     //Setup BVHTreeFromMesh
00685     memset(data, 0, sizeof(*data));
00686     data->tree = tree;
00687 
00688     if (data->tree) {
00689         data->cached = TRUE;
00690 
00691         data->nearest_callback = mesh_edges_nearest_point;
00692         data->raycast_callback = NULL;
00693 
00694         data->mesh = mesh;
00695         data->vert = mesh->getVertDataArray(mesh, CD_MVERT);
00696         data->edge = mesh->getEdgeDataArray(mesh, CD_MEDGE);
00697 
00698         data->sphere_radius = epsilon;
00699     }
00700     return data->tree;
00701 
00702 }
00703 
00704 // Frees data allocated by a call to bvhtree_from_mesh_*.
00705 void free_bvhtree_from_mesh(struct BVHTreeFromMesh *data)
00706 {
00707     if (data->tree) {
00708         if (!data->cached)
00709             BLI_bvhtree_free(data->tree);
00710 
00711         memset( data, 0, sizeof(*data) );
00712     }
00713 }
00714 
00715 
00716 /* BVHCache */
00717 typedef struct BVHCacheItem
00718 {
00719     int type;
00720     BVHTree *tree;
00721 
00722 } BVHCacheItem;
00723 
00724 static void bvhcacheitem_set_if_match(void *_cached, void *_search)
00725 {
00726     BVHCacheItem * cached = (BVHCacheItem *)_cached;
00727     BVHCacheItem * search = (BVHCacheItem *)_search;
00728 
00729     if (search->type == cached->type) {
00730         search->tree = cached->tree;        
00731     }
00732 } 
00733 
00734 BVHTree *bvhcache_find(BVHCache *cache, int type)
00735 {
00736     BVHCacheItem item;
00737     item.type = type;
00738     item.tree = NULL;
00739 
00740     BLI_linklist_apply(*cache, bvhcacheitem_set_if_match, &item);
00741     return item.tree;
00742 }
00743 
00744 void bvhcache_insert(BVHCache *cache, BVHTree *tree, int type)
00745 {
00746     BVHCacheItem *item = NULL;
00747 
00748     assert( tree != NULL );
00749     assert( bvhcache_find(cache, type) == NULL );
00750 
00751     item = MEM_mallocN(sizeof(BVHCacheItem), "BVHCacheItem");
00752     assert( item != NULL );
00753 
00754     item->type = type;
00755     item->tree = tree;
00756 
00757     BLI_linklist_prepend(cache, item);
00758 }
00759 
00760 
00761 void bvhcache_init(BVHCache *cache)
00762 {
00763     *cache = NULL;
00764 }
00765 
00766 static void bvhcacheitem_free(void *_item)
00767 {
00768     BVHCacheItem *item = (BVHCacheItem *)_item;
00769 
00770     BLI_bvhtree_free(item->tree);
00771     MEM_freeN(item);
00772 }
00773 
00774 
00775 void bvhcache_free(BVHCache *cache)
00776 {
00777     BLI_linklist_free(*cache, (LinkNodeFreeFP)bvhcacheitem_free);
00778     *cache = NULL;
00779 }
